group.name: GDG Blrdroid - Bangalore Android Developers Group

events.description:
The Bangalore Android group's Meetup is targeted towards people who are linked to Google Android in some or the other way. Aim of this meetup would be to share Android specific knowledge and networking among the Android enthusiasts.

Bring your Android devices, your newly developed Android Applications, or check out what's new in Android.

Agenda (*Subjective to changes):
10.30 to 11.00 am – 3 words Introduction by members
11.00 to 11.10 am – StrumSoft Intro
11.10 to 11.40 am – Srinivas on “Android framework and application development”
11.40 to 12.00 pm – Debtaru on Tricks and Tips on Android "How to's"
12.00 to 12.20 pm – Sandeep Nama on “Bondi Widget framework on Android” 12.20 to 12.30 pm – Rajan from MOMOB on “Mobile Dev Conference”
12.30 to 12.50 pm – Neeraj on “Content Providers & running Android on VM for Non ARM based development.”
12.50 to 1.00 pm – Randy Ksar marketing guru of MOTODEV - USA via Skype
1.00 pm onwards – Refreshments and networking.

Carry your ID proof and laptops are allowed. WIFI being provided. For live Blogging, tweeting hashtag #BAUG.

group.name: GDG Blrdroid - Bangalore Android Developers Group

events.description:
Bangalore Android Group's 5th Meet up

When: Sunday, July[masked] , 2:00 PM - 5:00PM

Where:

ThoughtWorks Technologies (India) Pvt Ltd
ACR Mansion, 2nd floor, 147/F, 8th Main Rd.
3rd Block, Koramangala
Bangalore -[masked], India

Agenda:

2:00 to 2:45 - Arjun mehta on "Android: Opportunities Beyond the Mobile Phone"
Arjun Mehta recently graduated from Cambridge University with a degree in Applied Mathematics. He spent the previous year studying at MIT and together with a team of students and graduates from MIT, started a company called LeafLabs that is currently developing an open source prototyping platform for embedded electronics. He has also recently launched another company, called Shuruat, which is developing Android applications on non-mobile embedded hardware.

2:45 to 3:30 - Ankit on "Dalvik VM with JIT"
Android Engineer, Broadcom Reasearch India. Co-organizer, BLRDROID.

3:30 to 3:45 - Break

3:45 to 5:00 - Josh Rochlin (CEO, www.xtify.com) on "Going Beyond the App - Push Notifications and LBS"
Josh has spent the last 10 years building great companies. (He wasted the 8 years before that practicing law.) Josh was an early pioneer in the New York Internet venture community founding MyCalendar.com, and serving as its CEO before selling it to Sports Huddle in 2001 (now owned by CBS). Josh then led business development and strategy at GoAmerica (GOAM), the first wireless internet service provider (now Purple Communications). Prior to joining Xtify, Josh served as the Chief Administrative Officer at Marc Ecko Enterprises ($2 Billion worldwide sales), where he oversaw all non-apparel businesses and ventures. Josh serves on the Board of AVTV Networks and has previously sat on the boards of Al Ahram Beverages and Hydron Technologies.

Note: Mr. Josh will talk via skype. It is a tele - presentation.

events.name: Bangalore Android Group's 6th Meetup

group.name: GDG Blrdroid - Bangalore Android Developers Group

events.description:
Venue –

ThoughtWorks Technologies (India) Pvt Ltd ACR Mansion, 2nd floor, 147/F, 8th Main Rd. 3rd Block, Koramangala Bangalore
Agenda:

• 10.00 AM to 10.15 AM – Introduction by members & organizers

• 10.15 AM to 11:15 PM – Sanjay Swamy, currently working on the UID initiative will talk on Understanding Aadhaar (UID) and Opportunities for UID-based Mobile Applications.

About Speaker: Sanjay Swamy is the former CEO of mChek, and is currently working on the UID initiative, where he is defining the mobile strategy. In this presentation, Sanjay will talk about UID and how the Aadhaar platform can be used for developing Mobile Applications that will turn mobile phones into Point of Service terminals - whether in a shared kiosk model or in a personal device model. He will also show us some demos.

• 11:15 AM to 12:00 PM - Karthik Mahadevan, Director of Product Management at InMobi will talk on Economics of App Monetisation.

About Speaker: Karthik Mahadevan is a Director of Product Management at InMobi, where he leads the Smartphones Product Line. In this presentation he will talk about the different options available for Application developers to monetise their applications

• 12:00 PM to 12:15 PM – Break

• 12.15 PM to 1:00 PM – Bhavya Siddappa, Technology Evangelist at Teleca will talk on Dual Display for Android Applications.

From mobile to tablet, Android has gone a long way to emerge as a generic operating system. Dual Drift is a next generation, dual display mobile UI. Dual screens create exiting opportunities for great user experiences and more dynamic UIs with fast actions, adaptive content focus and dual multi-touch. The workshop will explore how to enable dual display on Android platform. Learn how internally Android renders on screen.

About Speaker: Bhavya is responsible for Technology trend evaluation and Analysis within Teleca. A Gold Medalist from Pune University, and has always been passionate about upcoming technology. Her current profile involves doing market research and analysis in the mobile space and providing leading edge technology solutions.

• 1:00 PM to 1:45 PM - Neeraj Jaiswal, Specialist at Tata Elxsi will talk on Android Performance.

About Speaker: Neeraj Jaiswal is specialist at Tata Elxsi and among one of the organizers of Bangalore Android User Group, he handles a lot of android development work at Tata Elxsi. He will present how android performance can be improved.

events.name: Launch of dev APIs+des kits of langoor.net

venue.name: IEM auditorium, RV College of Engineering

group.name: GDG Blrdroid - Bangalore Android Developers Group

events.why: Langoor(a digital media agency based in Australia)is looking to launch SDKs and design kits for langoor.net. The idea is build the first 'application store for websites' in India for a full service website creation and management system (langoor.net)
events.description:
This launchpad for langoor.net APIs/design kits is called the Developer+Designer Day. It is the prelude to an online competition that that runs for two weeks starting 28th March and ends 10th April. Langoor is offering prizes worth INR 100,000 to super cool features and designs participants can build for the platform. Other top features/themes get integrated in application store of langoor.net which give participants the opportunity to earn if they are picked up by langoor.net end-users.
You can find out more details and register for the JAM @ www.langoor.net/jam

events.name: Android Dev Camp Bangalore 2012 : Possibly India's biggest Android Hackathon

group.name: GDG Blrdroid - Bangalore Android Developers Group

events.description:
BLRDROID is proud to announce that we would be hosting the Bangalore chapter of the  Global Android Dev Camp 2012. More than 50 cities are going to be taking part in a massive development event at the same time. We want to get it rocking by trying to make it as big as possible & need your help for it. Our other goal is to actually get great apps on the market via this hackathon and we are not leaving anything to chance. We would have having daily Q&A & training sessions & mentors at the event.

Please note even though the Date above mentions 17th as the start date, the event is actually a week-long event spread across different locations.

There will be prizes up for grabs, a chance to meet & interact with some the industry’s best minds as they would be mentoring both on the technical and business aspects.

Agenda

Speaker Info: Badrinath Kulkarni, Android Developer
 

 

11:15 AM - 12:00 Noon -> Communication via Audio Jack

 

Speaker Info:
Sudar works as a Research Engineer with Yahoo Labs. He is interested in programming for web and mobile (especially Android) He creates robots as a hobby. More details at http://sudarmuthu.com
 

 

12:00 Noon - 12:30 - Break (Networking)
                                   

                              === App Demos ===
12:30 PM - 12:45 PM - "BeetRoute (Alpha)" By Gaurav Lochan
About the App: Beetroute is an app to help you with your commute, designed especially for cities in India. It will show alternate routes, provide traffic information (where available), and can even be used to send your location and a route to your location to a contact (FindMe).


 12:45 PM - 01:00 PM  - "Loremo" by Anirban


 About the App: This app is targeted towards enhancing the engagement between customers and merchants, by an improvised usage of loyalty rewards and points.

The unique value proposition of the app to users is in solving the chaotic manner in which merchants try to enhance customer relations - multiple loyalty programs, lack of transparency in awarding points, no scope of instant gratification for customers upon unlocking rewards, etc.

 

1:00 PM - 1:15 PM - "Thru The Galli" By Anenth

About the App:
Using this app, you can create Custom map directions from the nearest Landmark and share it as a link using SMS, Email and Facebook. Your friends can use this link to navigate easily to the desired location by following step-by-step instructions. The app uses Layar's Augmented Reality to make sure you reach the right place without any difficulty. The directions also can be viewed over a web browser.

1:15PM - 1:30 PM -  "DocuTrust" and  "DocuVerify" By Ramesh

About the App: 

 The app (DocuTrust) takes a PDF file as input and requests for a e-signature on the mobile.  It appends the e-signature at the end of the PDF and creates a new PDF file.   A digital signature is generated using RSA algorithms and  sent along with the e-signed PDF file to a recipient.   

Recipient receives the e-signed PDF and verifies (through the app DocuVerify) the digital signature so that he/she is sure that the document was not tampered with during the transmission.

=> Introduction to android/mobile technology

=> Android architecture

=> Anatomy of android apps, folder structure IDE and perspective

=> Android Components (Activities, Services, Broadcast receiver, Content provider etc)

=> Designing android apps

=> Hands on Session

=> Taking apps to Android marketplace and Carrer advice

Please RSVP for the event.

Note: This event is only For RV College Students, if you are not current student of RV Please don't RSVP you will not be allowed to attend this session.

If you want to conduct similar session in your college please drop a mail to [masked]

 

 

Prerequisite For Workshop please make sure you follow following steps to setup your development environment.

Go Here and Download ADT Bundle http://developer.android.com/sdk/index.html Extract the bundle open Eclipse/ADT Try a basic hello world program from this link http://developer.android.com/training/basics/firstapp/creating-project.html (only do Create Project With Eclipse Section) Run your app by creating an AVD http://developer.android.com/training/basics/firstapp/running-app.html see (Run on Emulator Section) Dont use Command line to build or Run, if you want to give a shot please go ahead. Please Make Sure you have Android 2.3.3 version with your Android Developer Tool. To add one go to

Eclipse -> Windows -> Android SDK Manager From SDK Manager Select Android 2.3.3 (API 10) (If already Checked no need to install anything new) Click on Install Package button in right corner In next Screen Select Accept all Radio button Click on Install Restart your Eclipse ADT.

group.name: GDG Blrdroid - Bangalore Android Developers Group

events.description:
Heads up!

We're up for September meetup.

Watch this space and your inbox for more details, Agenda to be updated soon.

::Flash Talks:: 

::Tech Talk:: 

Little Eye: Easily identify and fix performance issues in your android apps
Speaker: Gaurav Lochan, Little Eye Labs
About the talk: Performance is the #1 reason for why people uninstall apps. Its not just about how quickly your app runs, but also about how it consumes various resources (Battery, Memory, Network Data, disk space, etc)
Little Eye is an extremely easy to use, and yet powerful, performance analysis tool for Android apps.  It records activity from the app and the system, and is able to display this data, logs, as well as a screen-capture, all in a single view, so that one can easily correlate different things.  It analyzes app behavior and highlights bad patterns, and also rates the performance to help catch performance regressions.
Little Eye was developed entirely out of Bangalore.

Speaker Info: Gaurav has worked on diverse areas such as networking, multimedia, cloud computing, mobile apps, in companies like Microsoft, VMware and Flipkart.  He is currently an engineer at Little Eye Labs, building an awesome performance analysis tool for android apps.

events.name: BlrDroid & Ford present OpenXC Hackathon

group.name: GDG Blrdroid - Bangalore Android Developers Group

events.description:
Do you love cars and miss the days when you could easily tinker with them on the weekends? 

Are you a software or hardware hacker who wants to interface more easily with your vehicle? 

If so, read on ... 

Ford’s OpenXC platform is the first open source automotive platform that allows you to develop apps for your automobile. More precisely, OpenXC connects to your car through the OBD-II data port, and with a system of open source hardware and software, it draws and descrambles rich sensor data from your car’s digital core. For the very first time, you can pull data out of the awesome array of sensors and computers built into your vehicle! 

Think of the huge amount of data ready to be harnessed from your automobile’s sensors: super-precise rate of speed, steering wheel angle, accelerator pedal position, engine torque ... the list goes on. With OpenXC, you can listen to the information coming off the cars main computer and develop hardware modules and software apps to interface with your vehicle. OpenXC is a powerful new way to speak your car’s language. 

The OpenXC functionality is exposed via a Java library that includes some Android services your application can use. The library is available on GitHub in the OpenXC-Android repository. 

The OpenXC program runs all day Saturday, December 7, 2013. The basic idea for the event is for you to develop ideas and in the span of a day write a working application.

events.name: Blrdroid Teach at National Institute of Engineering Mysore

group.name: GDG Blrdroid - Bangalore Android Developers Group

events.description:
Please don't RSVP if you don't study at NIE Mysore, you will not be allowed to attend this workshop 

Continuing our journey towards helping students to get started with Android, we are conducting our blrdroid teach next workshop in NIE Mysore

This will be a one day workshop aimed to help Students get started with Android and Admob. This workshop is only for Students pleasing don't RSPV if you are not currently studying there

Agenda

The Session will be divided into 3 parts Theory, Hands on and group activity, here is a small overview of the topics which will be covered

=> Introduction to android/mobile technology

=> Android architecture

=> Anatomy of android apps, folder structure IDE and perspective

=> Android Components (Activities, Services, Broadcast receiver, Content provider etc)

=> Designing android apps

=> Hands on Session

=> Introduction to Admob and how to use this in your apps

=> Taking apps to Android marketplace and Carrier advice

Please RSVP for the event, if you study in NIE Mysore.

If you want to conduct similar sessions in your college please drop us a mail on [masked]

Prerequisite For Workshop please make sure you follow following steps to setup your development environment.

Go Here and Download ADT Bundle

http://developer.android.com/sdk/index.html

Extract the bundle open Eclipse/ADT Try a basic hello world program from this link

http://developer.android.com/training/basics/firstapp/creating-project.html (Only do Create Project With Eclipse Section) Run your app by creating an AVD

http://developer.android.com/training/basics/firstapp/running-app.html

See (Run on Emulator Section)

Don't use Command line to build or Run, if you want to give a shot to please go ahead.

Please Make Sure you have Android 4.0 version with your Android Developer Tool. To add one go too

=> Eclipse -> Windows -> Android SDK Manager

=> From SDK Manager Select Android 2.3.3 (API 10) (If already Checked no need to install anything new)

=> Click on Install Package button in the right corner

=> In next Screen Select Accept all Radio button

=> Click on Install Restart your Eclipse ADT.

events.name: Startup Droid August Edition

venue.name: NASSCOM 10000 Startup Warehouse
venue.address_1: Diamond DIstrict, Old Airport Road Bangalore

group.name: GDG Blrdroid - Bangalore Android Developers Group

events.description:
StartupDroid agenda
(Details: http://www.blrdroid.com/2014/08/05/starupdroid-android-apps-developers/)

We at Blrdroid thrive to make India Mobile Ecosystem better, with aim of getting high quality and beautifully designed apps from Indian entrepreneurs. To help startups achieve this and grow their mobile offering we have designed the agenda of StartupDroid. 

Overall the program is Divided into 3 parts: 

=> Design
=> Develop
=> Distribute

Design

=> Quick introduction to design and why you need it, interacting with designers

=> An overview of prototyping, some tools that make android prototyping easy (Live Demo)

=> Interaction and Visual design, tools for android, photoshop templates, creating assets, an example of the instagram application (Live Demo)

=> Overall android UX design, guidelines, best practices.

=> Material design introduction, whats new in L and direction of design on android

=> OpenSource projects/libs recommendations and further reading (code, books and resources)

Develop

=> Introduction to an android app architecture, how best apps do it ?

=> Image loading done right, how to create image heavy applications that loads instantaneously

=> Taming the network request, how to create applications that do ultrafast networks calls !! Ever thought how flipkart apps loads so fast even on 2G ??

=>Decoupling your app, how decoupling of application components with event bus can help you in long run

=> ORM in Android, how to utilize in app database without the SQL mess. 

Distribute

=> How to grow your app from 100 to 100K users
=> Common Pitfalls, how to avoid getting kicked out of play store.

(This is an invite only event, No RSVP required.)

events.name: Droidcon 2014

group.name: GDG Blrdroid - Bangalore Android Developers Group

events.description:
Note: This is a paid event by HasGeek, and BlrDroid is cross promoting it. Please purchase the Tickets on the Droidcon Website

----------

Where will the next billion mobile users come from? What are the emerging markets? The common answer- India. Even though, India qualifies as the perfect market for app developers now, and for the near future, there are a large limitations owing to the state of our infrastructure. How can these be skillfully maneuvered pertaining to the interests and demands of the end user?

This year, HasGeek is organizing the fourth edition of Droidcon, India’s largest Android conference, on the 5th and 6th of December. Every year, Droidcon brings together developers, app designers and content providers, to talk about the latest trends around working with Android, as well as the challenges associated with a mobile ecosystem that thrives on open-source software on all sorts of hardware platforms. This year, Droidcon includes speakers talking on themes ranging from hardware, data sync and versioning, as well as UI/UX and Android wearables, among others. Plus, app demos - the idea is to showcase how Android is being tooled to add value to the world at large, through apps for mobile, as well as wearable/IoT solutions. Take the stage on the spot to showcase your apps.

Droidcon India 2014 looks to be a platform for both engaging conference sessions and informal networking and brainstorming discussions. The conference theme and topics intend to include beginner, intermediate and advanced audiences, offering takeaways for each group, thus ensuring a wide spread. And with HasGeek’s commitment to open-source, the event promises to be a great launchpad for open-source project maintainers, as well as anyone who wishes to be a part of an open-source effort. Further on, with companies like Microsoft, Intel and Epson being a part of the conference, one can expect some interesting sessions and conversations on how the industry views Android, and how their products advance the state of the Android ecosystem. Also, watch out for the upcoming open source giant Cyanogen at Droidcon and hear their story on scaling open source to commercially viable entities and on the much anticipated announcements on engagements with Micromax Yu.

Why should you attend Droidcon? Well, if you’re an Android app dev, Droidcon is that one place where you get to meet a lot of interesting people, working on a myriad range of ideas, and thus adding value to the whole concept behind Android. With networking sessions and app demos lined up, you also get the chance to showcase your work to the perfect audience. To sum it up, if you’re an Android junkie, then Droidcon India’s the place to be. Plus, to make it even sweeter, HasGeek is offering a 20% discount to BLRDROID members, simply follow the ticket link below to register, and use the discount code,  #@BLRDROID@# .Get set for some exciting and interesting conversations around Android!

Event Details:

Dates: December 5th and 6th, 2014
Event Website: http://droidcon.in/

Tickets: https://in.explara.com/e/droidcon-2014

More queries, write to: [masked]

Venue: MLR Convention Centre, JP Nagar. Bangalore.

events.description:
Android ecosystem and apps are constantly evolving with new technologies, new design patterns, new libraries etc. It is essential for everyone to keep them self versed as things progress. 

We at BlrDroid want to take the level of android development in India 1 level up, to help developers with new patterns and technologies we are starting our new program : BlrDroid ProSess

events.name: AppExpo 2016

group.name: GDG Blrdroid - Bangalore Android Developers Group

events.description:
The AppExpo is not a usual event with Sessions & talks, It is literally an Expo, where you can come and meet Awesome apps and talk to their people. It is also a stage for these apps to showcase themselves, talk to the community & gather feedback. 

Note: While it is a day long event, you can walk in anytime. You will also have the power to vote for your favorite apps. 

• Apps Showcase

• Recipe book 

• SignEasy 

• Helpchat 

• VoLT 

• Strike for Gmail

• Buyhatke 

• ClearTax

• Furlenco

• Rapido

• Panaroma 360

• YourStory

In addition we will have office hours all day from the following folks, you can ask them questions regarding your App: 

1. Android Dev - Anup Cowkur (GDE Android), Indraneel Bommisetty (Head - Products & Data Sciences at BlackBuck) & Abhishek Nandi (ex-MoEngage, Huawei & Infosys)

2. Design - Muthu Rajamani (UX at Cisco Systems), Soham Mondal (GDE UX)

3. Analytics & Growth - Ravi Vyas (CEO PureMetrics)

4. Learning Android - Udacity 

5. Deep Links - Branch.io

6. Google - Amrit (DA for Google)

7. Twitter - Aman Alam (DA for Twitter India) 

Plus there will be a few AppExpo Alums at the event, you can hit them up with questions if you seem them around.

Testimonial

The App expo gave us an opportunity to connect with the smartest minds in the Android ecosystem. We networked with entrepreneurs, VCs and many smart developers. These connects have been invaluable in our journey. We were adjudged the best app at the Android app expo and that gave us a lot of visibility. We got into deeper engagement with few people we met at the Expo who contributed immensely to improving our product. - John Paul from Plackal

Some of Alumni of the Blrdroid AppExpo

• Haptik 

• LoveCycles

•  mGaadi

•  MobiKwik

•  English Dost 

• Momoe

• NowFloats

• NewsHunt

Note:

• The facility has pay and park.

• While this is a full day event, we won't be providing lunch to the attendees.

events.name: #113 - BlrDroid : Jan 2020 Meetup

group.name: GDG Blrdroid - Bangalore Android Developers Group

events.description:
Hello All,

We are doing our first meetup of 2020 @ Gojek.
Stay updated by following us on Facebook, Twitter & Slack.

Agenda:
10:00 to 10:45 - MvRx + Epoxy = 🔥 by Kalyan Dechiraju
(Senior Android Developer at Playo - https://twitter.com/kalyandechiraju)

The talk focusses on how to leverage AirBnb's MvRx and Epoxy libraries to improve the application's codebase. Explanation about each library individually and then how to combine them and use in your app. Kalyan will also share his experience about how he implemented them in the Playo App.

10:45 to 11:05 - CameraX: Make photography easier on Android! by Bapusaheb Patil (Mobile Engineer @ Softway - https://twitter.com/baps_patil)

In this session, Bapusaheb will talk about the new CameraX library in Jetpack by Google.
CameraX makes implementing features like image preview, image analysis and image capturing easier. It also helps us leverage additional and in-demand features like Portrait, HDR, Night mode, and more. He would like to create more awareness around this library, talk about how this makes it easier than before to implement camera features and show users how to implement this library in their app.

11:05 to 11:20 - Break

11:20 to 12:00 - Simplifying class manipulation using the Transform API by Farmaan Elahi (Partner at Triveous - https://twitter.com/FarmaanElahi)

Transform API is a part of the Android Gradle Plugin and provides hooks to manipulate the compiled class during the build time before classes are given for Dexing.
It simplifies injecting custom class manipulation without having to deal with Gradle tasks and offers more flexibility on what is manipulated. Some of the projects using the Transform API are ProGuard, MultiDex and RetroLambda. People who are attending the talk will learn how the Android Gradle Plugin works and how they can use the Transform API to manipulate java class files.

Gojek Tech
Diamond District, 4th Floor Tower B, HAL Old Airport Rd, Bengaluru, Karnataka[masked]

events.name: #114 - BlrDroid + BlrKotlin: April 2020 Meetup - Online

group.name: GDG Blrdroid - Bangalore Android Developers Group

events.description:
Hello All,

We are hosting our next meetup online on YouTube in collaboration with BlrKotlin.

YouTube live link will be updated here on Meetup, Twitter and Slack 10 mins before the event starts. You can also follow us to get the latest updates.
YouTube - https://www.youtube.com/c/gdgblrdroid
Twitter - https://twitter.com/blrdroid
Slack - http://bit.ly/blrdroid-slack

Agenda :

10:00 to 10:15 - Better git commit messages for Android apps by Dinesh Shanmugam (https://twitter.com/hdshan23)

The talk is about the importance of often neglected git commit messages. Detailing on a good format of commit messages and how we can use git to enforce commit templates. Also about how good commit messages can improve engineering productivity when scaling teams.

10:15 to 11:00 Things to watch out in Android R by Amrit Sanjeev (https://twitter.com/amsanjeev)

11:00 to 11:45 What The Context? by Adnan A M (https://twitter.com/AdnanM0123)

Context in Android is probably the most confusing topic for even the most seasoned Android developers. Most of us have been burned in one way or the other due to the lack of clarity on what Context is on Android and how to use it.

In this talk, Adnan will try to demystify what context is on Android & explain the various options and their implications. We will try and understand how the various contexts differ and why should you as developer care. We will also have a final cheat sheet to use going forward so that you are absolutely sure about which context to use & when.

events.name: #115 - BlrDroid May 2020 Meetup - Online

group.name: GDG Blrdroid - Bangalore Android Developers Group

events.description:
Hello All,

We are back with our second online meetup. It will be streamed live on YouTube so tune in before 10 mins of the event to get the link.

You can also subscribe to our YouTube channel to get notification about all future online events - https://www.youtube.com/c/gdgblrdroid

Agenda :

06:00 PM to 06:45 PM - Building a better codebase with Lint by Subhrajyoti Sen (https://twitter.com/iamsubhrajyoti)

Lint is a powerful static analysis tool that can be used to enforce coding styles and also find common bugs across a codebase. Google provides a bunch of lint checks by default for Android.

In this talk, Subhrajyoti will discuss some examples of custom lint checks they use at Tickertape to enforce out design guidelines. He will go through the source code of some Android lint checks and then show how to write a custom lint check. By the end of the talk, you will be able to understand how lint works and how they can add custom lint rules to your project.

06:45 PM to 07:30 PM - Go with the Flow by Akshay Chordiya (https://twitter.com/akshay_chordiya)

Kotlin Flow is yet another implementation of Reactive Stream specification made on top of coroutines for Kotlin.
In this talk, we will look at Kotlin Flow, why it was introduced, how it's different from RxJava and share our journey of migrating from RxJava

Agenda
- Overview of Kotlin coroutines
- Why Flow and its history
- Basics of Kotlin Flow
- How it compares with RxJava and LiveData
- Why and how to migrate from RxJava 1 or 2
- Working with RxJava ❤ Flow in a single codebase
- Magic of multi-platform
- Tests
- Conclusion

You’ll walk away with a clear idea of what Kotlin Flow is and how it compares with other reactive implementation particularly RxJava and how to evaluate and how you can gradually migrate from Rx.

YouTube live link will be updated here on Meetup, Twitter and Slack 10 mins before the event starts. You can also follow us to get the latest updates.
YouTube - https://www.youtube.com/c/gdgblrdroid
Twitter - https://twitter.com/blrdroid
Slack - http://bit.ly/blrdroid-slack
